review_title: It's free, so keep that in mind
one_reviews_text:
Ok, so the game is free and there isn't that much room to complain. Simple ride and shoot game game, but... The ride is sickeningly, mind-numbingly fast. I could find no option to slow down and reduce the chances of hurling.
If you clench your jaws and stick the ride out, they flip you around so you have really no option but to crash.
Could be higher rated if you could slow it down a bit, but as is you really have to focus on not crashing rather than shooting cut and paste zombie figures.

when I downloaded this game it gave me a virus don't download.
I can't even shoot anything, the graphics are HORRIBLE and it's bascially a waste of megabytes, 1 star for being free

Get ready for some good old whiplash as you use your mouse to shoot and your head to steer. Game moves so fast it's silly. Except for the giant zombies, which if you manage to hit them enough times, fall over slowly. Could be a half decent game if crashing into a building wasn't instant death.

The developer, Program-Ace, is based in Ukraine and promises R&D and innovation on their website. However, this game supposedly published by them, is not featured on their website even under the VR section. It's no wonder, because nobody would want to be associated with this flaming garbage pile. I would never think about contracting Program-Ace for a project after seeing what a god awful puke festival they have publicly displayed. If I could give negative stars, I certainly would. I'm actually shocked this got past editorial review. I mean if any living, breathing human being were to allow this audio/visual assault on their consciousness, I'm sure they would have had to question their life path (after recovering from an hour spent next to the toilet). Shame on Oculus for allowing this to exist on their store.

After reading the requirement stuff on here, I noticed it said Keyboard+mouse. I haven't tested the keyboard, but the mouse button fires the guns. Luckily my mouse cord was long enough, but still issues with looking right or left but i'm turning the opposite direction.

There is no way to shoot. I have literally 6 different triggers to shoot, and none of them do anything. So if you want to experience a caotic hyper fast nausia inducing game, this is it. All it does is run rediculously fast through a never ending giant city with no traffic, no roads, really nothing but a grid system on the ground and absurdly tall zombies with no way to shoot them. There is no way possible that Program-Ace released this.
Bad clone of Poly Runner VR...and that is a two star game at best. If you could actual shoot the zombies, pick up special weapons, etc...you might have a better game.
